Hey  <@U0260V1BX>, I could use a little help understanding what context this hexagon spinner will be used so I know how it should be sized. Will it (1) spin alone on a blank grey screen or will it (2) be played over a full page of content or (3) will it play _in_ a specific piece of content (e.g. you press charge on a device in My Devices and the spinner loads only in that list item while it connects)?
i think it will likely play on a blank screen with some UI at the top.
for instance, i search for a wattup location in North Portland
and i am in list view
a spinner would appear while the results load
his doc said "3. Busy icon or loading indicator icon or text image. This will be used in situations like locating the list or map nearby locations."
Ok, would it be appropriate to size it small like the default spinner then or would a larger spinner work (sized like the demo video they sent as an example)?
i would make it small
i would also maybe make a version that has a bg... that could overlay a map
and maybe its just the default bg color so that version can be used either way
Like a small box surrounding it?
yeah
Ok cool. That really helps. Thanks.

after the first time the user uses the app

and i call it out in our handoff doc
so - i think we need some guidance on this
even though it is a small thing
i'm certain ziba will side for full animation - including fade in

no, i mean for the first run

So here's the thing: The animation begins both by fading in from nothing but the logo is rotated 30ish degrees before it starts playing. So there can be no static logo, then begin animation rotation, etc because that would be awkward and redundant.
right but you understand the splash screen dilemma i'm having here right?
If we can replace the animation with our static screen after first launch then this would be solved.
and that's where i think it'd be great to get clarification from somebody so we're not eating the time of doing, redoing, etc
i see your points - both of you
the static screen needs to be there while the app/animation loads
the animation, as design starts from a poor point in terms of 'splash screen'
perhaps we can specify a different splash screen for the first app visit
I'm just telling you all how it is working with the animation file they sent me. If we want a better solve, we need a different animation.
and the AE file (?)
